entries.content: Starting log organization task - focusing on host logger first. Goal: scan all logger calls and classify them into logical groups for better organization and debugging.

Analyzed 1000+ logger calls across 238 files. Found patterns:
- Component-based prefixes: [ComponentName]
- Lifecycle events: initialization, ready, disposed
- Operation tracking: started/complete/failed patterns
- Error detection and debugging
- Permission workflows
- Streaming operations
- Session management
- Tool execution
Need to classify into logical groups for better organization.

Completed classification of logger calls. Identified 10 major categories:
1. Lifecycle (init/ready/disposed)
2. State Management (transitions/updates)
3. Provider Operations (switch/restore/initialize)
4. Streaming (chunks/events/completion)
5. Permission Workflows (requests/responses/auto-approve)
6. Session Management (create/resume/track)
7. Tool Execution (start/end/errors)
8. Message Routing (dispatch/process/validate)
9. File Operations (read/write/open)
10. Error Handling (validation/failures/recovery)

Each category has specific patterns and use cases.
